items.title: Laurentian Bank announces sale to Fairstone Bank and National Bank
items.summary_auto: Fairstone Bank of Canada has agreed to acquire Laurentian Bank of Canada for $1.9 billion in cash. As part of the deal, Laurentian Bank will sell its retail and small-and-medium-sized business banking portfolios and syndicated loan portfolio to National Bank of Canada.

items.title: 'Is she alive?': Indonesian man's hopes of finding missing wife fade after flood disaster
items.summary_auto: In the days since cyclone-induced floods and landslides battered Indonesia's Sumatra island, Abdul Ghani has been carrying around a picture of his missing wife, showing it to everyone he meets.

items.title: Trump officials in Moscow as Russia and Ukraine fight over key eastern city
RCMP restricts use for most of Chinese-made drone fleet over 'high security risks'
Hong Kong leader orders independent inquiry into deadly highrise fire
items.summary_auto: Hong Kong's leader said on Tuesday a judge-led committee will investigate the cause of the city's deadliest fire in decades and review government oversight of building renovations blamed for fanning a blaze that killed at least 151 people.

items.title: As women with ‘invisible illnesses’ struggle to be believed, a report on chronic pain could help
items.summary_auto: Medical professionals say a 2021 report supported by Health Canada could have a major impact on how the medical system can better understand chronic pain and the best ways to diagnose it — but with its release during the height of COVID-19 pandemic, the report flew under the radar, and some doctors and advocates are hoping that can chanage.

items.title: What a N.S. palliative care unit tells us about Canada’s rural health care challenges
items.summary_auto: The five-bed palliative care hospital unit in Lunenburg, N.S., is still searching for staff, four years after it was first announced.

items.title: Family of ‘Mr. Christmas’ carries on his legacy of lighting up North Rustico for the holidays
items.summary_auto: James Gallant died earlier this year, and his children are keeping his family tradition alive in North Rustico. We take a look at the thousands of Christmas lights they set up to honour their father’s memory.

items.title: Insufficient evidence to proceed with charges in N.L. children’s hospital drug theft
items.summary_auto: Data obtained by CBC News through access to information shows high-risk medication goes missing every year from hospitals across Newfoundland and Labrador.

items.title: In text messages, Ontario women accused of murder described boy in their care as ‘loser,’ trial hears
items.summary_auto: The Ontario Provincial Police sergeant who led the investigation into Becky Hamber and Brandy Cooney testified at their first-degree murder trial Monday, outlining evidence collected in the case against the couple. The Crown showed multiple images and played audio recordings of women interacting with the boys in their care.

items.title: What does suspending Alberta’s clean electricity regulations mean for Canada’s climate goals?
items.summary_auto: The federal government suspended the regulations meant to rein in Canada’s worst polluter, but it hasn’t explained how it is going to ensure the country’s climate goals will be met. Carbon pricing, though, is expected to play a dominant role.

items.title: Alberta Metis eying ownership stake in proposed oil pipeline
items.summary_auto: The Metis Settlements of Alberta say they’re interested in purchasing a stake in a proposed oil pipeline to the West Coast and want to work with First Nations in British Columbia who oppose the project and plan to bring forward an emergency resolution at the Assembly of First Nations meetings in Ottawa Tuesday.

items.title: City of Ottawa pushes to make ByWard Market a national historic site
items.summary_auto: City of Ottawa staff are looking to ask the federal government to deem the ByWard Market a national historic site to help celebrate its 200th birthday.

items.title: RCMP restricts use of its Chinese-made drones — the vast majority of its fleet
items.summary_auto: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police is limiting the use of its 973 Chinese-made drones to non-sensitive operations, stating the devices present "high security risks, primarily due to their country of origin."

items.title: Survivors, supporters mark 65th anniversary of central Alberta bus crash that killed 17 people
items.summary_auto: Seventeen teenagers were killed on Nov. 29, 1960 when a train crashed into their school bus as it was travelling from Chipman, Alta., to Lamont.

items.title: #TheMoment scientists came upon a rare photosynthesizing sea slug
items.summary_auto: Scientists Elli Ofthenorth and Hunter Stevens tell The National about the moment they stumbled across a rare photosynthesizing sea slug that looks like a leaf while snorkelling near Halifax.

items.title: Calgary man guilty of terrorism offences for fighting with ISIS in Syria
items.summary_auto: Jamal Borhot, who travelled to Syria with his cousin more than 12 years ago, has been found guilty of terrorism offences after a judge ruled that the evidence shows he was fighting for ISIS.

items.title: Flooding recovery efforts underway in Indonesia, Sri Lanka, Thailand as death toll tops 1,000
Any Canadian who asks for HIV prevention drugs should get them, doctors say
items.summary_auto: For the first time since 2017, Canadian doctors have released updated clinical guidelines for antiretroviral medications used to prevent HIV.

items.title: This Ontario bill could change loyalty, rewards point rules
items.summary_auto: Critics are raising concerns about a provincial bill they say opens the door to changes for consumer rewards programs. But as CBC's Shawn Jeffords reports, the Ford government is denying it will change rules and allow points to expire.

items.title: Northern Ontario steel mill issues layoff notices to 1,000 workers
Polytechnique expands scholarship program to 14 women in memory of 1989 tragedy
items.summary_auto: Polytechnique Montréal is expanding its scholarship program honouring the 14 women who were killed at the engineering school 36 years ago.

items.title: Another son of 'El Chapo' pleads guilty to U.S. drug trafficking charges
items.summary_auto: A son of notorious Mexican drug kingpin "El Chapo" pleaded guilty Monday to U.S. drug trafficking charges, months after his brother entered a plea deal.

items.title: 'Outpouring of kindness' for Ottawa Charge head coach after breast cancer diagnosis
items.summary_auto: Carla MacLeod has been diagnosed with breast cancer, but the overwhelming and positive response to the announcement is giving the Ottawa Charge’s head coach confidence in her fight.

items.title: Inuvialuk designer looks back proudly on Project Runway Canada experience
items.summary_auto: Inuvialuk designer Taalrumiq says her time on Project Runway Canada was a "career highlight" and an opportunity to showcase some of her culture.

items.title: Nor'easter to bring snow, rain and wind to the Maritimes starting Tuesday evening
items.summary_auto: CBC meteorologist Ryan Snoddon says people should prepare for potential power outages and ferry and bridge delays or closures as wind gusts reach 70-90 km/h.
